questions.uddipok:
Make tag questions with the following statements:
(a) The habit of reading is good, ____ ?
(b) But we hardly find it in us, ____?
(c) Everybody loves a studious student, ____?
(d) We ought to give him books, ____?
(e) Books give us knowledge, ____ ?
(f) To read good books is a choice, ____?
(g) Let us try heart and soul to form this habit, ____ ?

sub_questions.explanation:
(a) The habit of reading is good, isn't it?

(b) But we hardly find it in us, do we?

(c) Everybody loves a studious student, don't they?

(d) We ought to give him books, oughtn't we?

(e) Books give us knowledge, don't they?

(f) To read good books is a choice, isn't it?

(g) Let us try heart and soul to form this habit, shall we?

questions.uddipok:
Change the following sentences as directed.
a) Once there was a little boy named Anik.(Compound)
b) Though he was a nice little boy, he was not an ordinary child. (Simple)
c) His parents saw him last three months ago.(Negative)
d) His parents liked him very much. (Interrogative)
e) Everyone expected the boy would be a good man.(Voice)
f) He was very attentive to his study. (Exclamatory)
g) He also helped his mother in his free time.(Complex)
h) How kind of him to help his mother! (Assertive)
i) He was one of the most intelligent boys in the school. (Positive)
j) He worked hard so that he might shine in life.(Compound)

sub_questions.explanation:
(a) Once there was a little boy and his name was Anik.
(b) In spite of being a nice little boy, he was not an ordinary child.
(c) His parents did not see him for the last threç months./Didn't his parents see him last three months ago?
(d) Didn't his parents like him very much?
(e) It was expected that. the boy would be a good man./That the boy would be a good man was expected (by everyone).
(f) How attentive he was to his study!
(g) He also helped his mother when he was free./He also helped his mother when he had free time.
(h) It was very kind of him to help his mother.
(i) Very few boys in the school were as intelligent as he.
(j) He wanted to shine in life and so he worked hard.

Sumona Akter Class: [Your Class] Roll No: [Your Roll Number] Khulna Zilla School [Date]
The Headmaster Khulna Zilla School Khulna
Subject: Request for Increasing Common Room Facilities
Dear Sir,
On behalf of the students of our school, I would like to bring to your kind attention the inadequate facilities in our school’s common room. As you are aware, the common room is a vital space for students to refresh their minds and engage in recreational activities during breaks. However, the current setup is insufficient to meet the increasing needs of the students.
The common room lacks adequate seating arrangements, indoor game facilities, and updated newspapers and magazines. During recess, it becomes overcrowded, leaving many students without the opportunity to utilize the space effectively. We are hopeful for your understanding and prompt action in this regard.
Thank you for considering our request.
Yours faithfully,
Sumona Akter On behalf of the students Khulna Zilla School

questions.uddipok: A rickshaw puller is a very familiar figure in our country. He plays a great role in our communication system. But he leads a very miserable life for financial problem. Now, write a paragraph in 150 words on "The life of a Rickshaw Puller".

sub_questions.explanation:
The Life of A Rickshaw-Puller

A rickshaw-puller is a person who earns his bread by driving a rickshaw. Very often he drives the rickshaw of others. He is quite familiar both in cities and towns. Generally, he lives in a slum. Though he works hard from morning till late night, he leads a poor life. He does not consider the condition of the weather. He works hard despite foul weather. Sometimes there arises a dispute between him and the passenger for fare. If he falls sick, his family members fall in distress. All of them have to starve. He cannot enjoy peace and happiness. He also suffers from inferiority complex. Besides, his children cannot hope for a bright future. Sometimes some passengers behave roughly with him. But he does not have sufficient strength to tackle it. Some rickshaw-pullers try to cheat the passengers. He takes rest here and there or sitting on his rickshaw. On the whole, his life is full of sufferings. To support his, family, he has to drive the rickshaw despite his sickness. In fact, he leads a poor and subhuman life.

questions.uddipok:
Nowadays people are suffering from various diseases. If they take physical exercise everyday, they can enjoy a sound health.
Now, write a composition on "The Importance of Physical Exercise." (250 words)

sub_questions.explanation:
Physical Exercise

Physical exercise means the movement of the limbs and organs of our body according to rules. Physical exercise is essential for sound health because it helps our body to be active. By taking regular physical exercise, we can keep ourselves fit.

There are different kinds of exercises like free hand exercises, yoga, weight lifting, gymnastics, acrobatics and so on. Free hand exercises help one to get sound health. Weight lifting is for professional players. Walking is good for all. For the children, running, swimming and playing ordinary games are suitable.

The importance of physical exercise in our practical life is very great. It helps us to build a sound body. It helps us to keep away from diseases. It is badly helpful for sound mind in a sound body.

However, excess of anything is bad. One should take exercises following the rules with proper diet and rest, 'otherwise he will suffer.

In our country, some people do not take physical exercise. They think that it is unnecessary and mere killing of time. But, ′ i n { }^{\prime} \mathrm{in} ′ in fact, they are wrong. By taking physical exercise, we can remain healthy and do our respective jobs properly. Without physical exercise, our health breaks down and we suffer from various diseases and complications. We should take exercise according to our age and condition of our body. Then we can be benefited very easily from every kind of exercise.

In short, physical exercise is necessary to build a nation. Healthy children are the healthy citizens of the future. So we should all take physical exercise regularly as a part and parcel of our daily life to live a healthy and happy life.
